name: Sean Kingston
politicalViews: Kingston is a Democrat who might also be a liberal.
author: Tom Kershaw

content.text: Sean Kingston, whose real name is Kisean Anderson, was born in Miami, Florida and grew up in Kingston, Jamaica.

content.sourceTitle: What is the religion of Sean Kingston
content.text: Kingston is very religious. He's a Christian of some kind. Some speculate that he's a Catholic,
but that would seem unlikely considering only 2% of Jamaicans are Catholic while the overwhelming majority are Protestants of some kind.
Either way, he's certainly the faithful type. His Twitter feed is intermittently spattered with things like:
Even when it looks like there is no way, GOD can make a way.
God gives us peace about our past, joy for our present & hope for our future. Your strength, peace & joy is in the LORD!
When Kingston was seriously injured during a jet skiing accident, his aorta was torn–an injury with roughly a 10% survival rate. Kingston credited God for getting him through it:

content.sourceTitle: Sean Kingston On Almost Dying Twice. 'You Had A Guardian Angel.'
content.text: It feels great, it's a blessing. God is great. For me to still be here it's only God's work. My work is not done. It wasn't my time yet.

content.sourceTitle: Rapper Sean Kingston Says Chill With Your Dogs, Don't Chain Them
content.text: He lent his star power to PETA, encouraging people not to leave their dogs chained up for long periods of time.
It's a bit of a stretch, but generally PETA is associated with liberals.
We can be sure, however, that he's down with the Democrats. He's a big Obama supporter. When the president won reelection in 2012, Kingston tweeted:

content.sourceTitle: SeanKingston: Obama, Sir, they can't hold…
content.text: Obama Sir, they can't hold u back! the proof is there u deserve the best lets go!! #2012.

I'm reluctant to call Kingston a liberal Democrat–definitely a Democrat–but my guess is the PETA thing was only because Kingston really loves his dogs. There's really nothing else to indicate any leanings to the left.
